17A140C69F99463C86BE445CBE6281A7.description: Use graphic data and other sources to analyze information about a public issue in the United States and evaluate alternative resolutions.

460CC07B904241D0A1AED85D3B48B0BB.description: Describe how global competition affects the national economy.

39F96C1697404B4B83FFA9BB8AC698CD.description: Explain how changes in the United States economy impact levels of employment and unemployment.

0470D7E03FE242B79850F65F4B26C174.description: Explain why public goods (e.g., national monuments, interstate highways, public libraries, public parks) are not privately owned.

35F2057D578A4F769DAC4CC04DE6EC6F.description: Explain how work is a form of continuing participation in God’s creation, how we are called to protect the dignity of work and the basic rights of workers, and describe the circular flow model of money being exchanged for goods and services.

FE4D96C626A74140AEB04DC0F7A040C3.description: Explain supply and demand by using examples of how competition among buyers results in higher prices and competition among sellers results in lower prices.

69BF64E6B1C5433CB81154F27C3266FF.description: Describe some characteristics of a market economy that serves its people, and describe how positive and negative incentives influence behavior in a market economy.

4923F39B97AE457385A67373D7F4748E.description: Explain how the federal government uses taxing and spending to serve the purposes of government.

5B6D39502B20492C99EC5F24A04A65A4.description: Describe how the powers of the federal government are separated among the three branches of government.

EEBEA8FD584A4BB3989152D1158069A1.description: Give examples of powers granted to the federal government and those reserved for the states and how this relates to the Catholic principles of solidarity and subsidiarity.

8CC7A2B0234546868F1EEDD3FA5A5DA0.description: Explain how the principles of popular sovereignty, rules of law, checks and balances, separation of powers, and individual rights serve to limit the powers of the federal government as reflected in the Constitution and Bill of Rights.

48DD4FD2387F40D6B385D0DE324B20A1.description: Identify the purposes of government as stated in the Preamble of the Constitution.

B890399BA0A94191A5C8D7BBF2DC014C.description: Describe the positive and negative effects of human activities in the United States that have altered the natural environments of specific regions, as God calls us to care for our common home on earth.

1AE5DB9A136144FF98EE24AD921A7F25.description: Identify factors that influence the migration of people within or to the United States, and describe the impact of immigration to the United States on the cultural development of different places or regions of the United States.

BDFCF53EE90B4297B75B0AD45A8F7079.description: Locate on a map and describe the modern influence of sites of historic Roman Catholic influence, identify the population density of Catholics in the United States, and describe the influence of Catholics in political and business leadership roles in the United States.

868B9621530A4C468EBB01564093DA15.description: Locate and describe human and physical characteristics of major United States regions and compare them to the Great Lakes Region.

90A5F5B153C844BB98715F8CD89CDA96.description: Use hemispheres, continents, oceans and major lines of latitude to describe the relative location of the United States on a world map.

7B0F3F591AF041858B4B403EDBECBCF5.description: Use geographic tools and technologies to describe geographic patterns of the United States in terms of elevation, climate, and population density.

C3B0D81F2B7B4FBA9393BF3263FC5328.description: Pursue peace and truth through the demonstration of respect for the attributes of various cultures, as we are called to be one human family on earth.

A7F8DC334FB34DA5B0CADA1CB8F28283.description: Apply Catholic virtues and democratic principles when working with others.
